captions.text:
Hi there! And welcome to the sporty
two-seater
roadster edition of Head 2 Head.
This is the manliest thing I've ever done in my life!
On my right
is the Mercedes Benz SLK55 AMG.
To my left is the Jaguar F-type V6 S.

Now I've been living with this
particular car for six months. Reason why
it's part of the Motor Trend long-term fleet
and it was assigned to me and I mean yeah,
luckiest boy in the neighborhood because just look at it,
and and listen to it. And also
I've grown very accustomed to almost every person I pass on the street

giving me the thumbs up it's just a very
lovable car.

But let's not discount the SLK55 AMG in
fact the reason I thought to bring this car
was
about two years ago when they launched it I was driving the white one
there was a white SLS AMG Roadster behind me

that's just a better overall sports
car yet I was able to stay out in front
of it as hard as that guy was trying.
I spoke with him later he was trying he couldn't pass that's because this
thing handles so well, it's so light, it's so sporty

it's just a really great roadster but
then again

so is this. Which ones the better
two-seater?
That's what we're going to find out.

First thing that jumps out at you about
all F Types they use something called

soft paint. Not a great name but like the
starter button
the shift paddles, the kinda passenger grab handle,

it's all coated in this soft paint stuff which
just feels like

the highest end rubber you can imagine
just makes it
feel premium. Now ever since the concept the CX16 Jaguar's made a big deal about how
this is
more of a cockpit than a cabin the shifter's like a

something a fighter pilot would
hold and what they wanted is

controls so that you can kinda like
activate various performance functions
without having to take your eyes
off the road. That is totally true from

one and that is the little rocker switch
which turns dynamic mode on/off.

Dynamic mode is the most important
part in the F-Type
because while it sharpens the throttle and shift time
and all that

it turns on the sport exhaust. Our sound
guy

actually had to change the audio levels
because dynamic mode
is just that
psychotic it's just that good!
Bellowing, that wild. And I mean its
so fun. What's the point of a convertible right?

Not the set lap times it's to make you
feel good and you know you get to hear
the audio track in this car
in a way that you just can't in a hard top and it

always makes you smile and that back
burble.

And it's just fun it makes you feel
great so
as far as a convertible goes this car really
lives up to its mission statement.
So here I am him driving the Mercedes Benz SLK55 AMG it's the little tiny hardtop
convertible.

And the first thing you got to point out
is that the
the sill is just a little too high to rest your arm on

in my mind the entire point of a
convertible as you put the top down

and cruise next to the ocean like doing
right now and you wanna sit like this
while doing so.
That's not the right angle it's not good so
what doesn't bug me is the lovely shape on the steering wheel.

I'm a sucker for it reminds me of the
wonderful year I spent with a Cadillac
CTS-V Wagon

says Alcantara on the steering wheel
guys you're gonna make a steering wheel
wrap it in Alcantara. As for the rest of the cabin

you know it's fine the problem with that
is you know we've seen the new S-Class,
we've seen the new C-Class. Those might be the two best interiors on the planet.
And this is sorta yesterday's fish right this is what they were doing a while ago.

Everything's kinda looks old-school it
looks five or six years old.

One thing this car does have which
is just exquisite is the engine.

AMG makes a big 5.5 liter twin-turbo
called the M-157.
I know a lot about that engine because I went to Germany and screwed one together.

This is that engine minus the two
turbochargers.

Makes 415 horsepower and if you open
it up:
sounds pretty good it's pretty throaty. Now look Jaguar
they've cornered the market on shreaking 'oh my god' sounding

engines, but for a non Jaguar this is a
pretty sweet sounding motor.

And now's the part where we leave the
beach and head up to the test track.

The Jaguar's able to hit 60 miles per
hour in 4.4 seconds.
That's excellent for any V6.
A run thru the 1/4 mile in 13 seconds flat at 108.7 MPH.
It stops from 60 miles per hour in
108 feet. The Mercedes-Benz SLK55 AMG
with its big V8 is able to hit 60 miles per hour
in 4.2 seconds.
And since there is no replacement for displacement it
runs the quarter-mile in well 12.6 seconds
with a big boy trap speed of 113.3 miles per hour.
From 60 MPH the SLK55 stops in
107 feet.
The F-Type's road holding is
pretty good 0.93 G's.
And the Italian red Jaguar is able to run the figure 8 in 25.4 seconds.
The SLK's
road holding is exactly the same as the Jaguar 0.93 G's
and the much lighter SLK AMG is able to run around the
figure 8 in 25.1 seconds.
But as I always say limit handling is 1 thing.
The way these two roadsters behave in the real world
is something else entirely.
Here we are up above the canyons of Los Angeles in a
Mercedes-Benz SLK 55 AMG.
Nice big fat V8 like we talked about over 400 horsepower
makes some pretty good noises I can really push this little car.
Up here in the canyons I mean it just
really flies!
This steering is also wonderful you
see they get better, better, and better about turning and this is

no exception. In fact I would say that the
turning on this is kinda
sharper, crisper, more immediate than the Jaguar.

Very little to complain about. Oh yeah the
transmission you can really complain
about the transmission.
It's that familiar kinda dopey 7-speed
MCT wet clutch that AMG's been putting in everything for generations.

It's just kind of a slow transmission
which is a shame because it's a quick car.

Also no bueno are the brakes they're
good except when you compare to the
Jaguar's especially feel wise
they're no where near as good.
And I got to say despite any shortcomings
it really is a thrill to kick this thing around a canyon road.
Of course that could be true of any roadster.
Obviously we're not
in the Jaguar F-Type S.
I say obviously because this engine is just so loud.
Ok Jaguar versus Mercedes the steering on this though not as precise it's a lot of fun
you're working a little bit more and that's the point of the
sport's car is to work harder.
Also this chassis is so much stiffer now
all F-Types they're all much stiffer.

there's heavy cars when someone stem
from that you know what I think that way
I'll take the brake penalty.

gauge right at the top the pedal you
think that wonderful in this a bike
really wanna sporty harmed more
now you want to be in dynamic mode which increases the throttle response and
shift times

and opened up the exhaust valves in
wanna go ahead and move the transmission
lever over into sport.
Now I already said when you're in dynamic mode
the transmission's in sport to think of this as
sport plus and it just holds onto gears longer, it shifts quicker,
and if you start using the paddles you get these wonderful
rightful sounding upshift it's awesome!
And really what Jaguar has done here is they've
come up with ultimate argument against the electric vehicle
because why would you ever want one because it will never be able to sound
like this.
This is what I want I don't want silence
I want sounds of wastefulness!
And sadly for Mercedes I don't want that SLK.
Good car and just not enough.
Therefore the winner of this Head 2 Head is
the Jaguar F-Type it's just righteous.

title: 2014 Jaguar F-Type V6 S vs 2014 Mercedes-Benz SLK55 AMG - Head 2 Head Ep. 56

comments.text:
They both sound amazing, performance edge to the Mercedes, but crikey is it 
butt ugly. I find this to be a common problem in the new generation of 
Mercedes, it's a true shame for an otherwise fantastic car/company. That 
Jaguar OTOH is absolutely stunning, blimey.﻿

comments.text:
I went down today to test drive the F-Type because like you I feel that the 
SLK's are just not there. I drive an SL550, which price wise compares close 
to the F-Type fully loaded but unfortunately for me, my legs were hitting 
the dash in the F-Type S series so I didn't drive it like I had planned. My 
legs were just a touch too tall for it and I had the seat all over... So I 
would like to see you compare your F-Type to a fully loaded SL along the 
same price range if you get a chance and compare these 2. I love my SL550 
but I'm always open to new ideas :) Great review!  ﻿

comments.text:

 Put a real driver with racing experience behind the wheel of these cars

by and has free towing.  Jag is rated as the most unreliable car out there 
with the poorest resale value but it does rate tops in one 
thing....depreciation. ﻿

comments.text:
Only half way thru the video and for me personally the AMG is a much better 
car overall. It looks better outside and inside even though the design 
language is 5 years old. It also performs better and the grumble of the 
naturally aspirated V8 sounds so much better than a supercharged V6. Also 
it costs less by a few extra thousands. The front end of the Jag is OK, but 
once it goes to the rear it looks disgusting. That's my take on these two.﻿
